An Absolute Masterpiece, Despite the graphics..

Half Life: if anything you recognize the name.

Introduction:

Half Life is close to the level of Doom when it comes to importance. At the time Half Life was cutting edge and introduced the new concept of level design that makes sense. Gone were the days of Romero's (admittedly fantastic) "abstract . . . design". Half Life was story driven, to be story driven and taken seriously, the setting had to seem real. It brought together it's spatial sense with aggressive action and interesting enemy designs. It had a simple story, but one that works well over the length of the game. Let's get into it, shall we?

1. Black Mesa

The setting; an X - Files - esque secret laboratory, both a government sponsored place of science, and a military bunker working with the unknown. It's a simple plot, but never had a plot of this magnitude been told in a video game. Before this, the only memorable shooter characters were Duke Nukem and Caleb from Blood. Throughout the game, you explore this facility, which is arguably a character itself. Journeying through Black Mesa reveals the questionable ethics of what had been going on there. It also features plenty of memorable scripted sequences and unique looking levels. All of this is shown to you in an unbroken first person perspective with no loading screens or breaks. 

2. Gameplay

Half Life has aged decently well in this case, the gameplay hasn't really fundamentally changed from Quake or Quake II, but the solid base is still there, this time with much more interesting weapons (not to devalue the Quake games, they have fantastic weapons in their own right) and the scripted sequences that really make the game immersive. These aspects really suck you in, so let's go over the weapons.

The crowbar, everyone know this one. The crowbar is your melee last resort and tool for breaking crates and vents.

The handgun, a pistol modeled after the Glock 17 of our own world. This is your bread and butter pistol, using the same ammo as the MP5 that comes later and stays a reliable long range weapon, It also stays useful for dealing with pesky headcrabs.

The Shotgun, and absolute classic. Definitely not realistic, as the alt fire (mouse 2 by default, every weapon has one) fires two shells at once, despite it having only one barrel. Great workhorse weapon for the Alien Slaves and a certain enemy I don't want to spoil.

The SMG, an MP5 that will probably be you main weapon. It's a little weird that it has a grenade launcher, but it's still a great weapon.

I'm going to stop here and I won't cover the enemies for the same reason: there's a lot of them and I don't want to spoil them as they're a lot of fun. Expect plenty of explosives and maybe even some "science" weapons.

3. Conclusion

Half Life is a great game, not perfect, but there is little for me to say that others haven't covered to death. Buy it an make sure to go into the options and turn off the HD model pack as they change the art style too much (use after your first playthrough, then see if you like them).

So finally, I do recommend Half Life, it really is special.
This game is great. If you don't have Half-Life yet, what are you waiting for? Such a classic and stands the test of time. Phenomenal.

It's a pretty slick game. I personally felt stupid playing it, but that's because you need to think about everything before going into a situation. There are cool puzzles that require absolutely god tier intellect that only avid 
Rick and Morty fans will have, So to wrap things up, I think that you haven't lived until you Half Lifed.

Maybe if it was the coast guard or the navy instead if the marines! Guns? Zombies? Assassins? Experiments? I DON'T CARE! HOWEVER, there is ONE redeeming factor in this WHOLE GOD AWFUL GAME THAT has LED me TO give IT a POSITIVE review. the part with the Ichthyosaur in the shark cage redeems this fucking shit game. positive.

[h1][b]The Game that Pioneered Storytelling in Games[/b][/h1]
Half-Life is a very well-known game franchise and it is most well known for having a story play around you as you progress through the game. This is pretty commonplace nowadays however and some people say the story of Half-Life is dull but I don't think so, even after over 20 years the story of Black Mesa and Gordon Freeman are still very immersive and is very enjoyable to play through. I recommend this game if you enjoy any Valve title because this is where their roots came from. And in Valve's own words and I quote, the graphics are:

Frighteningly realistic.

Aun espero el 3. Perdon, tenia que decirlo. Ahora, a lo que vengo:
Lo jugue fuera de steam y me lo pase como 20 veces o mas.
Es increible.
Es un sentimiento que no se explica! Si o si se siente, se juega. O no se entiende si no.
Asi que no dire absolutamente nada, mas que animate y jugalo.
Compralo, descargalo, instalalo, jugalo.
Despues veni y hablamos. Hay mucho que compartir. Hazte un favor, te hara feliz.
TE VAS A ENAMORAR DE ESTE JUEGO.
